bug.short_desc: [Webapp] Allow topic to link directly to the "print" feature

long_desc.thetext:
The Help system includes a nice Print button, for exporting topics and sub-topics out to a single HTML page that can be printed.
We want to include a hyperlink in certain topics to highlight this feature and point out that there is a "print ready" version of this topic and subtopics.
Can you please make the print feature available as a command or easily authored URL that takes current topic or specific topic as an argument.
I don't think that this will be difficult although I won't know for sure until I start to work on it. Targeting Eclipse 3.4.

Aren't there similarly related use cases in this area? To need a general way to invoke the buttons at the top of the help window?
For example, what about the "Show in TOC" button? I can easily see a user arrives at a topic via inline linking between topics, reads through the topic, and then is confused about how to see where that topic appears in the TOC hierarchy. (In fact, we've had users in the past confused about how to do this--and not notice the "Show in TOC" button. That's how it came about there are 2 of them in the full help window).
--Lee Anne

I'm removing the 3.4 milestone because looking at the list of enhancement requests that did not make it into 3.4 there are some which seem more important than this one, Bug 107648 in particular should have a higher priority.
